step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, lift cab over frame.

caution.para: Do not put all cab weight on chassis until all mounting bolts are tightened.
Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are aligned properly or damage can result.

step1.para: Carefully lower cab down over front and rear mounting locations, making sure that cab floor carriage bolts at rear and front cab mounting brackets are aligned properly as cab is lowered onto frame.
Install hex flange nut onto the threaded stud of the front cab chassis mounting bracket.
Repeat step 3 for opposite side front mounting. Tighten both nuts but do not torque yet.

Install three hex flange nuts onto the three carriage bolts (Item 2, Figure 2) protruding through rear bracket (Item 4, Figure 2) on underside of cab floor (Item 3, Figure 2). Tighten all nuts but do not torque yet.
Repeat Step 5 for opposite side mounting. Tighten all nuts but do not torque yet.
Torque both front mounting hex flange nuts to 142 to 175 lbf-ft (193 - 213 Nm).
Torque all rear mounting hex flange nuts to 88 to 106 lbf-ft (119 to 144 Nm)
Connect the transmission module connector (Item 1, Figure 6) to the transmission control module (Item 2, Figure 6).
Install the ABS module reservoir line (Item 4, Figure 5) to the underside of the cab floor (Item 3, Figure 5) and secure with four clamps (Item 2, Figure 5) and four screws (Item 1, Figure 5).
Install the parking brake cable (Item 1, Figure 4) to the parking brake cable bracket (Item 3, Figure 4) and secure with parking brake cable nut (Item 2, Figure 4).
Install the torsion bar (Item 3, Figure 3) to the torsion bar bracket (Item 2, Figure 3) with the hex head bolt (Item 1, Figure 3) and hex nut (Item 4, Figure 3).
Using the appropriate service manual replace all items that were disconnected prior to removing the cab.
Road test vehicle. Be sure all vehicle components are operating properly before putting vehicle back into operation.
